metadata.title: CVE-2023-48234 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Vim is an open source command line text editor. When getting the count fora normal mode z command, it may overflow for large counts given. Impact islow, user interaction is required and a crash may not even happen in allsituations. This issue has been addressed in commit `58f9befca1` which hasbeen included in release version 9.0.2109. Users are advised to upgrade.There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-48234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.15').
